comment: Super sweet and caring. Class is very interesting and goes over a lot of the psychological and sociological reasoning behind financial decisions. Definitely the easiest upper level course I've ever taken. Just skim over the slides and videos before taking the quizzes and it's an easy A. Grades come from 1 homework rest is quizzes/ discussion posts.
The last review below this one sums her and the course up well. Take her and this class for one of your Finance BBA Group A electives.

Great Professor and easy class! Graded on 1 Homework assignment, which is a completion grade, 5 discussion posts, 4 exams (5 total, 1 dropped), and 1 final exam. The exams are open note and on D2L. The professor was extremely sweet and flexible (I signed up for her 9 AM course, but she allowed us to attend her 10 AM) Highly recommend!
Dr.Ackert is a great professor. The class was always interesting, and attendance is not required. The exams were open notes and not that difficult if you look at the PowerPoint.
Easy A!

I think Dr.Ackert  is a good professor, and everything is clearly stated in the syllabus. There are a lot of lecture, video, and articles  which helps understand the information. The exams aren't bad if you actually dedicate time to study the PPT, video's, and articles.

She is kind professor who's know she is talking about. The quizzes (60%) were not bad. The cumulative final exam (20%) was also not bad. You do have to do discussion post that is worth 16 %. She provides ppt and uploads the reviews. This is one of the easier finance classes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: If you struggle in math courses take the kind woman. She helps. So grateful.

She is kind and knows what she is talking about. The quizzes were not bad. The cumulative final exam with FRQs was also not bad. You do not necessarily have to come to class to make a high grade as she provides ppt with audio and uploads the handouts received in class to review whenever you want. This is one of the easier finance classes.

You're graded on multiple quizzes, a final exam, and a paper over one of the two mandatory documentaries. Since I took this class online, instruction relied on heavy usage of PowerPoints. However, I found her PowerPoints to be helpful. There are also various assigned readings/videos for the quizzes. I recommend Ackert with confidence.

The BEST professor. I worked my butt off in this class and really had to study (hard class/material), but professor was willing to meet me and work with me before every single exam. She is patient and wants to help her students succeed. I took Maymester it is HW assignments and four tests. I highly recommend this professor and would take her again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Ackert is great! She is very nice and does a good job of explaining the material. Her class is pretty interesting with psychology and finance mixed together. She wants you to do well and she doesnt try to trick you on quizzes. Take her!

Great professor and a fun class to take, especially if you like psychology and finance. Every class was interesting and she breaks down the material really well. As long as you show up, take notes, and study for the quizzes, you should be able to do well.
Such a nice lady! Is there to help you and takes the time to make sure you truly understand. Cant recommend her enough! TAKE HER!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Mandatory attendance worth 20% of grade. Only get 2 excused absences. 5 quizzes, 1 dropped. 4 total quizzes (all multiple choice) worth 10% each. Written end of the year project 10%. Final exam 30% which is part multiple choice, part written. No book. A lot of articles and in class exercises. Overall great course, and good professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's a solid choice. It is an interesting class and the tests are not bad at all. Good professor with a good attitude.

Take this professor. She's super caring and is the first professor I've taken at KSU that genuinely wants her students to succeed. I thought I wasn't going to pass the class so I didn't take the final. She reached out to me and asked me to take the final with her during office hours and ended up passing. Put in the work and you will succeed.

Really great professor. She is very knowledgeable about the class material and explains it well, and is very helpful if you have questions. Very easy class as long as you show up, pay attention, and study for the quizzes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Very interesting class. Attendance is 20% of your grade, that's why she does MWF format. Quizzes are 40% paper is 10%, and final is 30%. She is very matter of fact and not very emotional. She does care about the students and doesn't try to give any trick questions. Not a hard class, just show up to class, read the PowerPoints, and you'll do fine.
Take her. Can't recommend her enough.
Dr. Ackert is amazing. Very interesting and not difficult at all. She presents pretty complicated information in an easy to understand and digest way.

She is the best teacher I've had thus far! She genuinely wants her students to do well and not be tricked by questions. Her class is very well organized with many practice problems and not too much information in one day. Take above anyone else!
Study hard exam is easy B. practice exams similar to real exam. gives extra credit to exam grades. She answers any questions you have.

ONE OF THE BEST FINACE PROF AT KENNESAW! QUIZES ARE A EASY IF YOU PAY ATTENTION IN CLASS. THE FINAL IS VERY SIMILAR TO THE PAST QUIZES. TAKE HER!! SHE WILL LITERALLY SPENDS HOURS AFTER CLASS IF YOU NEED HELP WITH ANYTHING

Professor Ackert is the reason I switched to Finance as my major.  She is extremely thorough on explaining problems and material and will repeat anything you need 100 times.  The class was easy if you show up and listen, no real need to study.

I have taken her for 2 classes (3100 and 4,4560).  I'm not a finance major, but she made the material relevant for both Finance majors and non-finance majors.  If you aren't really a "finance" person, she's really the best one to take for Fin 3100.  Her behavioral finance class is an excellent business elective as well.

Dr Ackert is very helpful & patient when it comes to teaching Finance. Go to class everyday and take notes. You'll never open the textbook! Skim through the PP slides, study the in-class problems for each chapter, as well as the practice tests online. 4 tests, lowest dropped. Mandatory cumulative final. Got an 88 in the class and she gave me an A!
GPA booster

Prof. Ackert is a very nice professor. The class is well structured, if a little boring. 5 quizes with 20 questions each and only 4 are graded. Attendance is mandatory, so go to class and you'll get an A with no real problem.

She goes through the material kinda fast, but will answer questions. Will pick 3 highest graded exams out of 4, but still need to do final. She will curve test if needed. She lets you use a formula sheet on tests and you don't even need to buy the book.

Prof Ackert was great. Do the practice exams and the handouts from class and look over the powerpoints. Important to be in class for notes, she does not use the book much, but all info is in there. Only test grades and all from prior tests/powerpoints. Extra credit towards final for doing My Fin Lab hwk.

I had to drop out of Finance 3100 twice before I took it with Prof. Ackert. She made everything so much clearer and easier I was able to get a B in the class! Lets you use notes on the tests! Big help!

Dr. Ackert made the class interesting and informative. She made sure that the material was conveyed in a clear way and that the class understood it. Will help students out when needed and did get back with questions in a timely manner. Overall good class and professor.
Excellent teacher.  The explains everything very well, and gives plenty of bonus opportunities.  She drops the lowest of the first 4 test grades.

Wonderful teacher. Actually cares about teaching and helping students understand and succeed. Old version of the book was fine to use and cheaper..it helped me when studying for the tests. Def. recommend her to anyone

I took her for a special topics course. The subject was very interesting, but her teaching is a little bland. We had a research paper that was graded very harshly despite having plenty of good things to say about it.

Extremely boring class (so is the material); one of the easiest As ever. Prof. Ackert does a lot to help her students. She drops the lowest test grade (out of 3); gives decent bonus opportunities; and her practice exams are very similar to the real thing. You should try really hard to NOT get an A.

Wonderful professor for intro finance course. 3 tests and 1 required, comprehensive final; but drops lowest test grade of the first three. Personal formula sheets allowed on test days. Easy A, I'd say.
Very easy class. 4 tests and a final. She drops your lowest test grade which helped alot. Study the example tests she gives you and you will do good on the tests. No required HW or attendance.
She was great! Made understanding the material very easy. Provided answers to HW and the sample exams. Allows you to make a formula sheet for each test. Easy A if you try!

BORING! she reads straight from power points every class. tests are pretty easy, similar to practice tests which she goes over and explains. Homework not graded. Allows a formula sheet for tests and drops lowest score. Final is mandatory. Really nice lady but classes will put you to sleep.
she is so sweet and nice. all you have to study are her practice exams which she completes in class and you'll do great!

She is one of the best teachers I've taken...study guides are similar to tests, tests are pretty easy. Homework is not mandatory. Just study a little bit right before the test and you're fine. Pretty easy A.
Great teacher! A little dry sometimes in lectures but definitely go over the sample exams because her exams are close to those.

This professor really know her stuff. I thought this class would be so hard and it turn out  to be pretty easy. Lucy makes the material easy to understand. I actually learned something. I give her an A+.

Dr. Ackert is intelligent and available to students outside of class.  This is a math class. The material is complex and one of the more challenging concepts in the securities market industry.  If you attend classes (don't miss one) and skim the book, you will do well.  Permitted formula sheet for exams - including comprehensive final.
Tough class but Dr. Ackert is always available to provide extra help.
No Comments
Dry class. Uses overheads to do the lessons. Difficult, know the material very well. You get a 1 page formula sheet for the exams, cumulative by the way.
